service:
The AWS User Notifications API Reference provides descriptions, API request parameters, and the JSON response for each of the User Notification API actions.

User Notification control APIs are currently available in US East (Virginia) - us-east-1.

GetNotificationEvent and ListNotificationEvents APIs are currently available in commercial partition Regions and only return notifications stored in the same Region in which they're called.

The User Notifications console can only be used in US East (Virginia). Your data however, is stored in each Region chosen as a notification hub in addition to US East (Virginia).

operations.AssociateChannel: Associates a delivery Channel with a particular NotificationConfiguration. Supported Channels include AWS Chatbot, the AWS Console Mobile Application, and emails (notifications-contacts).
operations.CreateEventRule: Creates an EventRule that is associated with a specified Notification Configuration.
operations.DeregisterNotificationHub:
Deregisters a NotificationHub in the specified Region.

You can't deregister the last NotificationHub in the account. NotificationEvents stored in the deregistered NotificationHub are no longer be visible. Recreating a new NotificationHub in the same Region restores access to those NotificationEvents.
operations.DisassociateChannel: Disassociates a Channel from a specified NotificationConfiguration. Supported Channels include AWS Chatbot, the AWS Console Mobile Application, and emails (notifications-contacts).
operations.GetNotificationEvent:
Returns a specified NotificationEvent.

User Notifications stores notifications in the individual Regions you register as notification hubs and the Region of the source event rule. GetNotificationEvent only returns notifications stored in the same Region in which the action is called. User Notifications doesn't backfill notifications to new Regions selected as notification hubs. For this reason, we recommend that you make calls in your oldest registered notification hub. For more information, see Notification hubs in the AWS User Notifications User Guide.
operations.ListChannels: Returns a list of Channels for a NotificationConfiguration.
operations.ListEventRules: Returns a list of EventRules according to specified filters, in reverse chronological order (newest first).
operations.ListNotificationConfigurations: Returns a list of abbreviated NotificationConfigurations according to specified filters, in reverse chronological order (newest first).
operations.ListNotificationEvents:
Returns a list of NotificationEvents according to specified filters, in reverse chronological order (newest first).

User Notifications stores notifications in the individual Regions you register as notification hubs and the Region of the source event rule. ListNotificationEvents only returns notifications stored in the same Region in which the action is called. User Notifications doesn't backfill notifications to new Regions selected as notification hubs. For this reason, we recommend that you make calls in your oldest registered notification hub. For more information, see Notification hubs in the AWS User Notifications User Guide.
operations.ListTagsForResource:
Returns a list of tags for a specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

For more information, see Tagging your AWS resources in the Tagging AWS Resources User Guide.

This is only supported for NotificationConfigurations.
operations.RegisterNotificationHub:
Registers a NotificationHub in the specified Region.

There is a maximum of one NotificationHub per Region. You can have a maximum of 3 NotificationHubs at a time.
operations.TagResource:
Tags the resource with a tag key and value.

For more information, see Tagging your AWS resources in the Tagging AWS Resources User Guide.

This is only supported for NotificationConfigurations.
operations.UntagResource:
Untags a resource with a specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

For more information, see Tagging your AWS resources in the Tagging AWS Resources User Guide.

AccessDeniedException.base: User does not have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.CreateNotificationConfigurationRequest$a:
The aggregation preference of the NotificationConfiguration.

  • Values:

    • LONG

      • Aggregate notifications for long periods of time (12 hours).

    • SHORT

      • Aggregate notifications for short periods of time (5 minutes).

    • NONE

      • Don't aggregate notifications.

        No delay in delivery.
refs.GetNotificationConfigurationResponse$agg:
The aggregation preference of the NotificationConfiguration.

  • Values:

    • LONG

      • Aggregate notifications for long periods of time (12 hours).

    • SHORT

      • Aggregate notifications for short periods of time (5 minutes).

    • NONE

      • Don't aggregate notifications.

        No delay in delivery.
refs.NotificationConfigurationStructure$aggre:
The aggregation preference of the NotificationConfiguration.

  • Values:

    • LONG

      • Aggregate notifications for long periods of time (12 hours).

    • SHORT

      • Aggregate notifications for short periods of time (5 minutes).

    • NONE

      • Don't aggregate notifications.

        No delay in delivery.
refs.UpdateNotificationConfigurationRequest$a:
The status of this NotificationConfiguration.

The status should always be INACTIVE when part of the CreateNotificationConfiguration response.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • PARTIALLY_ACTIVE

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE. Any call can be run.

      • Any call can be run.

    • INACTIVE

      • All EventRules are INACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • DELETING

      • This NotificationConfiguration is being deleted.

      • Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

refs.NotificationEvent$aggregationEventType:
The NotificationConfiguration's aggregation type.

  • Values:

    • AGGREGATE

      • The notification event is an aggregate notification. Aggregate notifications summarize grouped events over a specified time period.

    • CHILD

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE. Any call can be run.

    • NONE

      • The notification isn't aggregated.
refs.NotificationEventOverview$aggregationEve:
The NotificationConfiguration's aggregation type.

  • Values:

    • AGGREGATE

      • The notification event is an aggregate notification. Aggregate notifications summarize grouped events over a specified time period.

    • CHILD

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE. Any call can be run.

    • NONE

      • The notification isn't aggregated.

refs.Resource$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. At least one id or ARN is required.

refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$includeChi: Include aggregated child events in the result.

refs.AssociateChannelRequest$arn:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Channel to associate with the NotificationConfiguration.

Supported ARNs include AWS Chatbot, the Console Mobile Application, and notifications-contacts.
refs.DisassociateChannelRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Channel to disassociate.
refs.ListNotificationConfigurationsRequest$ch: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Channel to match.

ConflictException.base: Updating or deleting a resource can cause an inconsistent state.

refs.GetEventRuleResponse$creationTime: The date when the EventRule was created.
refs.NotificationHubOverview$creationTime: The date and time the resource was created.

Dimension.base: The key-value pair of properties for an event.

refs.MessageComponents$dimensions:
A list of properties in key-value pairs. Pairs are shown in order of importance from most important to least important. Channels may limit the number of dimensions shown to the notification viewer.

Included dimensions, keys, and values are subject to change.

refs.DeleteEventRuleRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the EventRule to delete.
refs.EventRuleStructure$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.GetEventRuleRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the EventRule to return.
refs.UpdateEventRuleRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to update the EventRule.
refs.UpdateEventRuleResponse$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to update the EventRule.

refs.CreateEventRuleRequest$eventPattern:
An additional event pattern used to further filter the events this EventRule receives.

For more information, see Amazon EventBridge event patterns in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.EventRuleStructure$eventPattern:
An additional event pattern used to further filter the events this EventRule receives.

For more information, see Amazon EventBridge event patterns in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.GetEventRuleResponse$eventPattern:
An additional event pattern used to further filter the events this EventRule receives.

For more information, see Amazon EventBridge event patterns in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.UpdateEventRuleRequest$eventPattern:
An additional event pattern used to further filter the events this EventRule receives.

For more information, see Amazon EventBridge event patterns in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.

refs.EventRuleStatusSummary$status:
The status of the EventRule.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • The EventRule can process events.

    • INACTIVE

      • The EventRule may be unable to process events.

    • CREATING

      • The EventRule is being created.

        Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

    • UPDATING

      • The EventRule is being updated.

        Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

    • DELETING

      • The EventRule is being deleted.

        Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

EventRuleStructure.base: Contains a complete list of fields related to an EventRule.

refs.NotificationEvent$eventStatus:
The assesed nature of the event.

  • Values:

    • HEALTHY

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • UNHEALTHY

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE. Any call can be run.
refs.NotificationEventSummary$eventStatus:
The notification event status.

  • Values:

    • HEALTHY

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • UNHEALTHY

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE. Any call can be run.

refs.CreateEventRuleRequest$eventType:
The event type to match.

Must match one of the valid Amazon EventBridge event types. For example, EC2 Instance State-change Notification and AWS CloudWatch Alarm State Change. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.EventRuleStructure$eventType:
The event type to match.

Must match one of the valid Amazon EventBridge event types. For example, EC2 Instance State-change Notification and AWS CloudWatch Alarm State Change. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.GetEventRuleResponse$eventType:
The event type to match.

Must match one of the valid Amazon EventBridge event types. For example, EC2 Instance State-change Notification and AWS CloudWatch Alarm State Change. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.

refs.ThrottlingException$retryAfterSeconds: The number of seconds a client should wait before retrying the request.

refs.NotificationHubOverview$lastActivationTi: The most recent time this NotificationHub had an ACTIVE status.
refs.RegisterNotificationHubResponse$lastActi: The date the resource was last activated.

refs.ListChannelsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to be returned in this call. The default value is 20.

refs.ListEventRulesRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to be returned in this call. The default value is 20.

refs.ListNotificationConfigurationsRequest$ma: The maximum number of results to be returned in this call. Defaults to 20.

refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to be returned in this call. Defaults to 20.

refs.ListNotificationHubsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

refs.GetNotificationEventRequest$locale: The locale code of the language used for the retrieved NotificationEvent. The default locale is English en_US.
refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$locale: The locale code of the language used for the retrieved NotificationEvent. The default locale is English (en_US).

refs.EventRuleStructure$managedRules:
A list of Amazon EventBridge Managed Rule ARNs associated with this EventRule.

These are created by AWS User Notifications within your account so your EventRules can function.
refs.GetEventRuleResponse$managedRules:
A list of managed rules from EventBridge that are are associated with this EventRule.

These are created by AWS User Notifications within your account so this EventRule functions.

MessageComponents.base: Describes the components of a notification message.

refs.NotificationEventSummary$messageComponen: The message components of a notification event.

refs.MessageComponentsSummary$headline: A sentence long summary. For example, titles or an email subject line.

refs.ListChannelsRequest$nextToken: The start token for paginated calls. Retrieved from the response of a previous ListNotificationEvents call. NextToken uses Base64 encoding.
refs.ListChannelsResponse$nextToken: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.
refs.ListEventRulesRequest$nextToken: The start token for paginated calls. Retrieved from the response of a previous ListEventRules call. Next token uses Base64 encoding.
refs.ListEventRulesResponse$nextToken: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.
refs.ListNotificationConfigurationsRequest$ne: The start token for paginated calls. Retrieved from the response of a previous ListEventRules call. Next token uses Base64 encoding.
refs.ListNotificationConfigurationsResponse$n: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.
refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$nextToken: The start token for paginated calls. Retrieved from the response of a previous ListEventRules call. Next token uses Base64 encoding.
refs.ListNotificationEventsResponse$nextToken: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.
refs.ListNotificationHubsRequest$nextToken: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing notification hubs from the start.
refs.ListNotificationHubsResponse$nextToken: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

refs.AssociateChannelRequest$notificationConf: The ARN of the NotificationConfiguration to associate with the Channel.
refs.CreateEventRuleRequest$notificationConfi: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NotificationConfiguration associated with this EventRule.
refs.CreateNotificationConfigurationResponse$: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the resource.
refs.DeleteNotificationConfigurationRequest$a: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NotificationConfiguration to delete.
refs.DisassociateChannelRequest$notificationC: The ARN of the NotificationConfiguration to disassociate.
refs.EventRuleStructure$notificationConfigura: The ARN for the NotificationConfiguration associated with this EventRule.
refs.GetNotificationConfigurationRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NotificationConfiguration to return.
refs.ListChannelsRequest$notificationConfigur: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NotificationConfiguration.
refs.ListEventRulesRequest$notificationConfig: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NotificationConfiguration.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to list tags.
refs.NotificationConfigurationStructure$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to tag a resource.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to untag a resource.
refs.UpdateNotificationConfigurationRequest$a: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used to update the NotificationConfiguration.
refs.UpdateNotificationConfigurationResponse$: The ARN used to update the NotificationConfiguration.

refs.CreateNotificationConfigurationRequest$n: The name of the NotificationConfiguration. Supports RFC 3986's unreserved characters.
refs.NotificationConfigurationStructure$name: The name of the NotificationConfiguration. Supports RFC 3986's unreserved characters.

refs.CreateNotificationConfigurationResponse$:
The status of this NotificationConfiguration.

The status should always be INACTIVE when part of the CreateNotificationConfiguration response.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • PARTIALLY_ACTIVE

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE.

      • Any call can be run.

    • INACTIVE

      • All EventRules are INACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • DELETING

      • This NotificationConfiguration is being deleted.

      • Only GET and LIST calls can be run.
refs.GetNotificationConfigurationResponse$sta:
The status of this NotificationConfiguration.

The status should always be INACTIVE when part of the CreateNotificationConfiguration response.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • PARTIALLY_ACTIVE

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE.

      • Any call can be run.

    • INACTIVE

      • All EventRules are INACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • DELETING

      • This NotificationConfiguration is being deleted. Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

      • Only GET and LIST calls can be run.
refs.ListNotificationConfigurationsRequest$st:
The NotificationConfiguration status to match.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • PARTIALLY_ACTIVE

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE. Any call can be run.

      • Any call can be run.

    • INACTIVE

      • All EventRules are INACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • DELETING

      • This NotificationConfiguration is being deleted.

      • Only GET and LIST calls can be run.
refs.NotificationConfigurationStructure$statu:
The status of this NotificationConfiguration.

The status should always be INACTIVE when part of the CreateNotificationConfiguration response.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • All EventRules are ACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • PARTIALLY_ACTIVE

      • Some EventRules are ACTIVE and some are INACTIVE.

      • Any call can be run.

    • INACTIVE

      • All EventRules are INACTIVE and any call can be run.

    • DELETING

      • This NotificationConfiguration is being deleted. Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

      • Only GET and LIST calls can be run.

NotificationConfigurationStructure.base: Contains the complete list of fields for a NotificationConfiguration.

NotificationEvent.base: A NotificationEvent is a notification-focused representation of an event. They contain semantic information used by Channels to create end-user notifications.

refs.GetNotificationEventRequest$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NotificationEvent to return.
refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$aggregateN: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the aggregatedNotificationEventArn to match.
refs.NotificationEvent$aggregateNotificationE:
If the value of aggregationEventType is not NONE, this is the Amazon Resource Event (ARN) of the parent aggregate notification.

This is omitted if notification isn't aggregated.
refs.NotificationEventOverview$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.NotificationEventOverview$aggregateNotif: The ARN of the aggregatedNotificationEventArn to match.

NotificationEventOverview.base: Describes a short summary of a NotificationEvent. This is only used when listing notification events.

NotificationEventSummary.base: Describes a short summary and metadata for a notification event.

refs.NotificationEventOverview$notificationEv:
Refers to a NotificationEventSummary object.

Similar in structure to content in the GetNotificationEvent response.

NotificationHubOverview.base:
Describes an overview of a NotificationHub.

A NotificationHub is an account-level setting used to select the Regions where you want to store, process and replicate your notifications.

refs.NotificationHubStatusSummary$status:
Status information about the NotificationHub.

  • Values:

    • ACTIVE

      • Incoming NotificationEvents are replicated to this NotificationHub.

    • REGISTERING

      • The NotificationHub is initializing. A NotificationHub with this status can't be deregistered.

    • DEREGISTERING

      • The NotificationHub is being deleted. You can't register additional NotificationHubs in the same Region as a NotificationHub with this status.

refs.NotificationEvent$notificationType:
The type of event causing the notification.

  • Values:

    • ALERT

      • A notification about an event where something was triggered, initiated, reopened, deployed, or a threshold was breached.

    • WARNING

      • A notification about an event where an issue is about to arise. For example, something is approaching a threshold.

    • ANNOUNCEMENT

      • A notification about an important event. For example, a step in a workflow or escalation path or that a workflow was updated.

    • INFORMATIONAL

      • A notification about informational messages. For example, recommendations, service announcements, or reminders.
refs.NotificationEventSummary$notificationTyp:
The type of event causing the notification.

  • Values:

    • ALERT

      • A notification about an event where something was triggered, initiated, reopened, deployed, or a threshold was breached.

    • WARNING

      • A notification about an event where an issue is about to arise. For example, something is approaching a threshold.

    • ANNOUNCEMENT

      • A notification about an important event. For example, a step in a workflow or escalation path or that a workflow was updated.

    • INFORMATIONAL

      • A notification about informational messages. For example, recommendations, service announcements, or reminders.

refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$quotaCode: The code for the service quota in Service Quotas.
refs.ThrottlingException$quotaCode: Identifies the quota that is being throttled.

refs.CreateEventRuleRequest$regions: A list of AWS Regions that send events to this EventRule.
refs.EventRuleStructure$regions: A list of AWS Regions that send events to this EventRule.
refs.GetEventRuleResponse$regions: A list of AWS Regions that send events to this EventRule.
refs.UpdateEventRuleRequest$regions: A list of AWS Regions that sends events to this EventRule.

Resource.base: A resource affected by or closely linked to an event.

refs.ConflictException$resourceId: The resource ID that prompted the conflict error.
refs.ResourceNotFoundException$resourceId: The ID of the resource that wasn't found.
refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$resourceId: The ID of the resource that exceeds the service quota.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: Request references a resource which does not exist.

refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$resourceTy: The type of the resource that exceeds the service quota.

refs.SourceEventMetadata$relatedResources: A list of resources related to this NotificationEvent.

refs.NotificationEvent$schemaVersion: The schema version of the Notification Event.
refs.NotificationEventSummary$schemaVersion: The schema version of the Notification Event.

refs.ServiceQuotaExceededException$serviceCod: The code for the service quota exceeded in Service Quotas.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: Request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.

refs.CreateEventRuleRequest$source:
The matched event source.

Must match one of the valid EventBridge sources. Only AWS service sourced events are supported. For example, aws.ec2 and aws.cloudwatch. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.EventRuleStructure$source:
The matched event source.

Must match one of the valid EventBridge sources. Only AWS service sourced events are supported. For example, aws.ec2 and aws.cloudwatch. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.GetEventRuleResponse$source:
The matched event source.

Must match one of the valid EventBridge sources. Only AWS service sourced events are supported. For example, aws.ec2 and aws.cloudwatch. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.ListNotificationConfigurationsRequest$ev:
The matched event source.

Must match one of the valid EventBridge sources. Only AWS service sourced events are supported. For example, aws.ec2 and aws.cloudwatch. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$source:
The matched event source.

Must match one of the valid EventBridge sources. Only AWS service sourced events are supported. For example, aws.ec2 and aws.cloudwatch. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.SourceEventMetadata$source: The AWS servvice the event originates from. For example aws.cloudwatch.

SourceEventMetadata.base:
Describes the metadata for a source event.

For more information, see Event structure reference in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.

refs.SourceEventMetadata$eventType: The type of event. For example, an AWS CloudWatch state change.

refs.SourceEventMetadata$eventTypeVersion: The version of the type of event.

refs.SourceEventMetadata$relatedAccount: The Primary AWS account of Source Event

SourceEventMetadataSummary.base: Contains metadata about the event that caused the NotificationEvent. For other specific values, see sourceEventMetadata.

refs.SourceEventMetadataSummary$eventOriginRe:
The Region where the notification originated.

Unavailable for aggregated notifications.

refs.SourceEventMetadataSummary$eventType:
The event type to match.

Must match one of the valid Amazon EventBridge event types. For example, EC2 Instance State-change Notification and AWS CloudWatch Alarm State Change. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.

refs.CreateEventRuleResponse$statusSummaryByR: A list of an EventRule's status by Region. Regions are mapped to EventRuleStatusSummary.
refs.EventRuleStructure$statusSummaryByRegion: A list of an EventRule's status by Region. Regions are mapped to EventRuleStatusSummary.
refs.GetEventRuleResponse$statusSummaryByRegi: A list of an EventRule's status by Region. Regions are mapped to EventRuleStatusSummary.
refs.UpdateEventRuleResponse$statusSummaryByR: The status of the action by Region.

refs.NotificationEvent$sourceEventDetailUrlDi: The detailed URL for the source event.
refs.Resource$id:
The unique identifier for the resource.

At least one id or ARN is required.
refs.SourceEventMetadataSummary$source:
The matched event source.

Must match one of the valid EventBridge sources. Only AWS service sourced events are supported. For example, aws.ec2 and aws.cloudwatch. For more information, see Event delivery from AWS services in the Amazon EventBridge User Guide.
refs.ValidationExceptionField$name: The field name where the invalid entry was detected.
refs.ValidationExceptionField$message: A message with the reason for the validation exception error.

refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$startTime: The earliest time of events to return from this call.
refs.ListNotificationEventsRequest$endTime: Latest time of events to return from this call.
refs.SourceEventMetadata$eventOccurrenceTime: The date and time the source event occurred. This is based on the Source Event.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: The tag keys to use to untag a resource.

refs.CreateNotificationConfigurationRequest$t: A map of tags assigned to a resource. A tag is a string-to-string map of key-value pairs.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$tags: A list of tags for the specified ARN.
refs.TagResourceRequest$tags: A map of tags assigned to a resource. A tag is a string-to-string map of key-value pairs.

refs.Resource$tags: A map of tags assigned to a resource. A tag is a string-to-string map of key-value pairs.

refs.TextPartValue$textByLocale: A map of locales to the text in that locale.

refs.MessageComponents$headline: A sentence long summary. For example, titles or an email subject line.
refs.MessageComponents$paragraphSummary: A paragraph long or multiple sentence summary. For example, AWS Chatbot notifications.
refs.MessageComponents$completeDescription: A complete summary with all possible relevant information.

refs.TextPartValue$type: The type of text part. Determines the usage of all other fields and whether or not they're required.

TextPartValue.base: Describes text information objects containing fields that determine how text part objects are composed.

refs.TextPartValue$displayText:
A short single line description of the link. Must be hyperlinked with the URL itself.

Used for text parts with the type URL.

ThrottlingException.base: Request was denied due to request throttling.

refs.Resource$detailUrl: The URL to the resource's detail page. If a detail page URL is unavailable, it is the URL to an informational page that describes the resource's type.

ValidationException.base: This exception is thrown when the notification event fails validation.

ValidationExceptionField.base: Stores information about a field passed inside a request that resulted in an exception.

refs.ValidationException$fieldList: The list of input fields that are invalid.

refs.ValidationException$reason: The reason why your input is considered invalid.
